To the Board of Directors,

Following our assessment of the two divisions’ recent performance and the board’s directive for a rapid earnings inflection through targeted R&D investment, we recommend allocating the full ten-million dollars to the Consumer Products division under a three-stage funding plan. This approach is designed to deliver a swift proof of concept while capping downside exposure and maintaining clear go-stop gates throughout the development cycle.

Stage One will deploy approximately three million dollars over the next four months to support consumer focus groups, rapid prototyping, and preliminary margin modeling. During this period, Jennifer Wu, our Director of Product Development, and Marcus Taylor, Senior Finance Manager, will collaborate to validate consumer interest and project unit economics. We will require documented evidence of meaningful consumer engagement—quantified through a minimum threshold of pre-order intent and a projected gross-margin of at least twenty percent—before proceeding.

Should these criteria be met, we will authorize Tranche Two, channeling roughly four million dollars into tooling, pilot production runs, and limited market trials over the following quarter. Throughout all stages, responsibility for milestone sign-off will rest with the Consumer Products R&D Steering Committee, chaired by our EVP of Innovation, with finance oversight by the Office of the CFO. This structure ensures that every dollar is invested against transparent performance triggers and that we maintain the agility to halt the project if it underperforms.

By concentrating our ten-million investment in Consumer Products under these disciplined stage-gate controls, we aim to drive a rapid revenue uptick and restore that division to profitability within a single product cycle—while protecting the corporation against undue risk.
